document_data.name: Golden Gulf
document_data.mainbody: The '''Golden Gulf''' was a large body of water in southern [[Interior Zakhara|central Zakhara]] between the [[High Desert]] and the [[Cities of the Pearl]] in the [[West Zakhara|west]] and the [[League of the Pantheon]] in the east. To the north it contracted to form [[Suq Bay]], to the [[South Zakhara|south]] it first narrowed to then open into the [[Crowded Sea]]. [[Huzuz]], the City of Delights, was also called the jewel of Suq Bay and the Golden Gulf, sitting at the conjuction of the two.<ref>
document_data.Society and commerce:
Atop the waves, the Golden Gulf was a nexus of sea trade, featuring Zakhara's most important merchant cities along its shores, and with trade routes from the Crowded Sea and the [[Kara-Tur|far east]] passing through it towards the [[Cities of the Heart]] and the [[North Zakhara|north]].<ref><ref> The waters also provided its neighbors with a wealth of fish, [[pearl]]s and other products of the sea.<ref> Due to its importance, the strong navy of Huzuz kept patrols on the Golden Gulf.<ref>

Below the surface, nomadic tribes of [[locathah]] and [[sea elves]] roamed the area of both the Golden Gulf and the Crowded Sea.<ref> A sizable city of [[sahuagin]] lay somewhere in the west of the Gulf.
document_data.Weather: Storms were a common occurence and danger to ships in the Golden Gulf, especially in the central and eastern parts.
